main event: Observers in South Carolina reported seeing a very bright object shooting across the sky on April 24, 1950.
interesting points: The object was described as very bright and visible for at least 25 seconds,The object was about as large as the full moon and appeared to be at an altitude of 4,000 to 5,000 feet,Multiple reports came from different cities including Columbia and Charleston,One witness estimated the object to be 15 to 18 inches in diameter,The object moved at high speed and left no trail.
sighted object: a bright object shooting across the sky
witness description: Various observers in Charleston and Columbia
